member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager
member.summary: Manager class to start and stop the logging service for the Common Device API. Use the to instantiate logger objects of type .
member.remarks: Best practice: Create a logger for each class with the full qualified type name.

member.name: E:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.LoggerAdded
member.summary: Occurs when a new logger has been added.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.IsLoggingRunning
member.summary: Gets the flag indicating if logging is enabled and ready for use.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.LoggingFramework
member.summary: Gets the used logging framework.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.LogFolder
member.summary: Gets the folder location for the log files.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.CurrentLogFile
member.summary: Gets the current log file as absoulute file path.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.LogLevelsActive
member.summary: Gets the active log levels on which messages are logged.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.LogArchiveDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days to store log messages in archive.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.ProductName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom product name for the running application. The product name helps to seperate between logging sessions.
member.exception: Thrown, if value is null or an empty string.
member.remarks: This value is optional. If it's not set, it will use the product name of the executing assembly.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.IsDatabaseLoggingEnabled
member.summary: Gets the flag indicating if logging for database operatios is enabled or not.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.#cctor
member.summary: Static Constructor to initialize data

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.Start(Hbm.Api.Logging.Enums.LoggingFramework,Hbm.Api.Logging.Enums.LogLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Starts the logging service. If the logging is already active (see also ) the call has no effect.
member.param: Determines which logging framework is plugged into the application. See for more details.
Determines on which level(s) message are logged, see .
Valid directory to use for logging or empty to let LogManager generate valid folder.
member.remarks: If is set, logging service will not start. Even if is set.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.Stop
member.summary: Stops the logging service, if it is enabled. See .

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.CreateLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a logger object.
member.param: Name of the logger, for example the full qualified class name.
member.returns: Logger object, which can be used to log messages. See . Even if is false, an empty logger will be returned. This empty logger simply does nothing, so it is not necessary to do null checks when you want to log something.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.Flush
member.summary: Flushs pending log messages in buffers to disk.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.GetAllLoggers
member.summary: Gets all loggers.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.RaiseLoggerAddedEventAsync(Hbm.Api.Logging.Logger.ILogger)
member.summary: Raises the logger added event.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.InitiateLoggingFactory(Hbm.Api.Logging.Enums.LoggingFramework)
member.summary: Initiate the logging factory based on the given framework.
member.param: LoggingFramework determining which type of Logger is created (NLog / Loupe).

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.ReconfiguringLogLevelsOfUnderlyingLogger
member.summary: Reconfiguring the logger of the active framework to reflect the new log levels on each (already initiated) logger.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.LogManager.LogCurrentLogLevels
member.summary: Tries to log the current active log levels on: a) INFO b) DEBUG c) TRACE If none of those levels are active, nothing is logged.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Logging.Helper.LoupeRepositoryConfigUpdater
member.summary: Handles updates on the 'Local Repository Options.xml' of Gibraltar Loupe Desktop application. This file is needed to tell Loupe Desktop where it has to find the log files. The file is not created when Loupe Desktop is being installed, so it must be created or updated. The config file is also an user file. Path to find the file: %LOCALAPPDATA%\Gibraltar\Analyst

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.Helper.LoupeRepositoryConfigUpdater.UpdateLocalRepositoryOptionsFile
member.summary: Updates or creates the local repository options config file, which is used by the Gibraltar Desktop application.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.Helper.LoupeRepositoryConfigUpdater.CreateGibraltarRepositoryCongifFile
member.summary: Creates an empty repository config file for Gibraltar Desktop

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Logging.Helper.LoupeRepositoryConfigUpdater.AddCurrentLogFolderToRepositoryList(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Adds the current log folder as respository node to the config file of Gibraltar Desktop.
